newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RESEARCH ALERT-Australia collieries rated buy.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RESEARCH ALERT-Australia collieries rated buy.

text.p: Small Australian coal miners Cim Resources Ltd, Centennial Coal Co Ltd and Portman Mining Ltd have been rated buys by brokerage J.B. Were and Son.

In a research report sent to clients last month, the brokerage said Portman was in a phase of strong earnings growth and had exceptional brownfields expansion opportunities at its Burton high-margin coking coal mine in Queensland state.

Centennial, a producer of mainly thermal coal from its four mines in New South Wales state, runs a lean operation and its alliance with South Korean oil refiner Yukong Ltd positioned it well for expansion by acquisition, the report said.

Cim Resources is an emerging coal miner in New South Wales state with low capital, high-margin operations, it said. Cim Resources is poised to expand into Hunter Valley-based soft coking projects, it added.
The report was prepared when Cim Resources shares stood at A$0.78, Centennial at A$1.74 and Portman at A$2.42. Closing prices on Tuesday were, respectively, A$0.76, A$1.39 and A$2.75.
